definition: to leap forward/to make rapid progress/a leap forward
to jump/to leap
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies

sentences.english: Like those tadpoles, we grew legs and hopped off into the world.
sentences.chinese: 像那些蝌蚪一样，我们也逐渐成长，并跃进了世界。

sentences.english: During the Great Leap Forward in 1958, people rushed headlong into mass action to establish people's communes.
sentences.chinese: 一九五八年“大跃进”，一哄而起搞人民公社化。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the city continued to explode in the noonday of the country's hungry expansion.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，这座城市在国家疯狂大跃进中继续扩张。

sentences.english: Several writers for the Guardian have made what I believe is an unjustifiable leap.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，卫报的几位撰稿人来了个离谱的大跃进。

sentences.english: If we can apply that, that will be a great leap forward.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们可以对其加以应用，这将会是一次大跃进。

sentences.english: The technique for crossing a danger area is another form of bounding overwatch .
sentences.chinese: 穿越危险地段的技巧是掩护跃进的另一种形式。

sentences.english: Now it plans to make a great leap forward by producing its own cars.
sentences.chinese: 如今它计划大跃进，生产自己的汽车。

sentences.english: It marks a major development in the history of Shakespearian portraiture.
sentences.chinese: 这是在莎士比亚肖像画历史上的一大跃进。

sentences.english: Swedish industrial front is developing by leaps and bounds in the late years.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典的工业近年来出现了跃进的局面。

sentences.english: Its modernizing aims were dashed in the face of reality.
sentences.chinese: 大跃进的现代化目标在现实面前化为泡影。

sentences.english: The appearance of the "Great Leap Forward" broke the Movement that started not so long.
sentences.chinese: “大跃进”的出现中断了起步不久的知青运动。

sentences.english: Foxconn is proposing to do it all (pardon the inevitable pun) in one great leap forward.
sentences.chinese: 富士康计划在下一步的跃进中做到这一切。
跃进到更绿色的纳米技术？

sentences.english: But the highly sophisticated Siri software could represent a huge leap forward for the technology.
sentences.chinese: 但高度复杂的Siri软件将使这项技术实现跃进。

sentences.english: The disaster from the Great Leap Forward and the Chinese rural people's commune movement.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难源自大跃进和中国农村人民公社化运动。

sentences.english: Yet the Great Leap Forward was a monumental failure.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大跃进的一场令人刻骨铭心的失败。

definition: to leap
to jump/to leap
to plunge into/to jump into
to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
to rush in/to charge in
to jump out/fig. to appear suddenly
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to rush out
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
progress/to advance
to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
to surmount/to cross over
to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand
to seize (the strategic high ground)
